I think you can set the parameters in the broke’s config file. There are two parameters related to it, **fileReservedTime** means how long the message will be saved on the disk, its unit is hour, and the timeout message is automatically deleted, the default value is 48 hours, **deleteWhen** means when the delete action is performed , the default value of 04 indicates 4 am.

是我证书问题，打扰

In RocketMQ 4.3.0, I only found related modules in /rocketmq/broker/filtersrv directory. I tracked the code and found it would eventually start org.apache.rocketmq.filtersrv.FiltersrvStartup, but I didn't find this class in the rocketmq 4.3.0, so it start failed. I don't know why.

RocketMQ 4.3 removed filterserv module, and provided  a more elegant way to filter message，more details [reference](https://rocketmq.apache.org/docs/filter-by-sql92-example/) .
And issue only used for bug report or feature, if you want get more support, please subscribe Apache RocketMQ [mailing list](https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/)

@yixinwei This feature has been request in the [issue](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/403), and we are so glad to see some of your suggestions, designs and even pull a request.

I found this link.. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ROCKETMQ-133?jql=project%20%3D%20ROCKETMQ%20AND%20text%20~%20%22delete%22


It explains that TTL will be released in the 5.0.0 version...
Is any way to achieve this now...?
Because in the topics, message sizes are constantly growing...
ex: 

    TOPIC X has total offset's  -> 
                 2506317 on (10-09-2018)  
                2578690  on (11-09-2018)  
                2727109  on (12-09-2018)
                2854614  on (13-092018) 
                3414643  on (19-09-2018)

      TOPIC Y has total offset -> 
                608812 on (10-09-2018) 
                631980  on (11-09-2018)  
                913096  on (13-09-2018)  
                1000675 on (19-09-2018)

@RongtongJin 
As u mentioned above, default time would be 48 hours but still, messages are not deleted from the topic. Is there any other way to apply TTL functionality...

@huanwei Hi，we haven‘t released RocketMQ 4.3.1 and the file name just named as you want, as following image shows:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39583243/45357732-c87e3a80-b5f9-11e8-84b1-2ca01a53b1fa.png)
减少线程竞争锁，现在合并为一个文件之后，任何时刻都只能由一个线程持有锁。所以commit log合并为一个文件，并不是一个好主意

之前提问时描述可能描述的不够好，在这里再补充下：在RocketMQ4.3.0中，消息保存到commitLog之后，并不是马上就同步数据到对应的index和comsumeQueue，而是通过另外一个服务线程ReputMessageService定时的从CommotLog同步数据到comsumeQueue，假设生产者使用同步写的方式发送了100条消息到commitLog,当ReputMessageService同步到第60条消息的时候Broker突然断电了，一段时间之后，Broker又重启了，那剩下的未同步的40条消息是否还会继续同步到comsumeQueue？？我好像并未发现源码中有这个机制，望不吝赐教
It will be better to ask with a email after subscribe mailing lists; https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/

which version you are using?
If the problem is "No route info of this topic", FAQ url should be http://rocketmq.apache.org/docs/faq/. Please try the new FAQ url.
This indeed is a bug without checking addr, and maybe you can make a pull request to help solve this issue.

It seems have no defect.
Could you give some tests to show how this problem will affect the results.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/18999983/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/18999983)

Coverage increased (+0.02%) to 42.383% when pulling **80a98beefb2dff0c03438ab61121f28cc7d98561 on RongtongJin:master** into **a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1 on apache:master**.

If the broker is abnormally shutdown，the CommitLog will recover  from the storeCheckPoint and do dispatch in the recovering process.It has nothing to do with the ReputMessageService.

But actually, it is unexpected to see the log "logic queue order maybe wrong", this means that the message queue index is faster than the consume queue index. It seems that the slave got into an error state in the replicating from master. 

Could you reproduce this problem in the master?

Reading the code about recover() according to the prompt, the message will do reput. Analyzing the log again, i find some about the error log.
The first error log of ReputMessageService:
2018-09-11 16:46:46.976 WARN ReputMessageService - [BUG]logic queue order maybe wrong, expectLogicOffset: 1050988840 currentLogicOffset: 1050988820 Topic: role_change QID: 4 Diff: 20
The cqOffset reputing:52549442. There is something wrong with cqOffset 52549441 of qid 4.

From the producer log, the phyOffset is 80549937024 of cqOffset 52549441, as follow:
2018-09-11 16:37:32,006 [ INFO ] MissChecker - send msg success, topic:role_change, tag:1536655040000, index:399503976, result:SendResult [sendStatus=SLAVE_NOT_AVAILABLE, msgId=0AB314D91D3F070DEA4E3710B4E7BD18, offsetMsgId=0A60706900002A9F00000012C1267F80, messageQueue=MessageQueue [topic=role_change, brokerName=syz-00, queueId=4], queueOffset=52549441]

In the recover log broker, the max phy offset is 80549937216. As the messages with fixed length 192, the laste message offset is 80549937024 whose cqoffset is 52549441.
2018-09-11 16:44:11.292 INFO main - load over, and the max phy offset = 80549937216

And I find some log else about this issue:
2018-09-11 16:44:11.123 ERROR main - [BUG]read total count not equals msg total size. totalSize=192, readTotalCount=140, bodyLen=38, topicLen=11, propertiesLength=0
2018-09-11 16:44:11.134 INFO main - /home/suiyuzeng/store/consumequeue/0 mkdir OK
2018-09-11 16:44:11.134 WARN main - found a illegal magic code 0x0
2018-09-11 16:44:11.180 INFO main - topic:role_change, queue:4, queue offset after truncate:52549441, origin:52549441
The last line is added by me for debug.  In truncateDirtyLogicFiles() before return, get the cqoffset by getMaxOffsetInQueue(). And The cqOffset should be 52549442. 

I think the last message(cqoffset 52549441, phyoffset 80549937024)  was damaged. In the log, totalSize, bodyLen, topicLen are right but propertiesLength is wrong. As checkMessageAndReturnSize() find it abnormal and return false, the message is dispatched. 

      DispatchRequest dispatchRequest = this.checkMessageAndReturnSize(byteBuffer, checkCRCOnRecover);
      int size = dispatchRequest.getMsgSize();
      // Normal data
      if (size > 0) {
             ..........
       }

As the topic was not set in the DispatchRequest, we find the log " /home/suiyuzeng/store/consumequeue/0 mkdir OK ". So the message whit cqOffset 52549441 may was not despatch to the consume queue.

In recoverAbnormally() ,only the size is checked. Should we check isSuccess as in recoverNormally? Truncate the messages when isSuccess is false.

If you have usual questions, please go to the mailing list，next time.

I think my understanding of systemTopicList is incorrect.
At the beginning, I thought that getSystemTopicList means getting all the topic names, then I read the code carefully yesterday and found [RouteInfoManager.getAllTopicList()](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/namesrv/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/namesrv/routeinfo/RouteInfoManager.java#L86) has done this. I traced the call chain of getSystemToplicList and found [MQClientAPIImpl.getSystemTopicList()](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/client/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/client/impl/MQClientAPIImpl.java#L1600) is the last method called, so RouteManagerInfo.getSystemTopicList() never be called? ? ? 
At the same time, I found some systemTopic will be added in [rocketmq.broker.topic.TopicConfigManager#TopicConfigManager()](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/broker/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/broker/topic/TopicConfigManager.java#L57) when the BrokerController is initialized, including the broker name and cluster name. So systemTopicList should include broker name and cluster name. The original code is correct.
ok , thanks

I think my understanding of systemTopicList is incorrect.
At the beginning, I thought that getSystemTopicList means getting all the topic names, then I read the code carefully yesterday and found [RouteInfoManager.getAllTopicList()](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/namesrv/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/namesrv/routeinfo/RouteInfoManager.java#L86) has done this. I traced the call chain of getSystemToplicList and found [MQClientAPIImpl.getSystemTopicList()](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/client/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/client/impl/MQClientAPIImpl.java#L1600) is the last method called, so RouteManagerInfo.getSystemTopicList() never be called? ? ? 
At the same time, I found some systemTopic will be added in [rocketmq.broker.topic.TopicConfigManager#TopicConfigManager()](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/broker/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/broker/topic/TopicConfigManager.java#L57) when the BrokerController is initialized, including the broker name and cluster name. So systemTopicList should include broker name and cluster name. The original code is correct.
So @Ah39 would you please clarify your problem or what error occur? it is a by-design behavior to use the same client instance if not setting the instance name (i.e. using 'DEFAULT' name) . thanks

@ConeyLiu The client need to be compatible with 1.6. And I remember their is a compatible problem in ConcurrentHashMap, it will throw exception in 1.6 if its source is built in 1.8.
I will have a check when I am available next time.

I will appreciate @Ah39 engagement in the community if you could raise your question in the user email list. Issue is not the correct place for your request, please read the issue template, looking forward to your question in the email list :-)

@wangweifan In production, a cluster with same producerGroup is recommended, when a producer shutdown, broker will check for other surviving producers with the same producerGroup，and if there are no any surviving producers, broker will continue check after producer startup, so you need to be idempotent on both the producer side and the consumer side.
And the issue is used for bug report or feature request，If you are just asking for help,  you can use the mailing lists：https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/
预计多久下一个版本release？
the executeLocalTransaction @Override return is meaningless

@wangweifan this bug has been resolved in this [PR](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/pull/450), you can download source code and build in your environment. 
 If you don't want to build, you can use version 4.3.0 or earlier client, which is compatible. we will release new version ASAP.

@breakenknife 你好，可以自己把本地事务包装为一条事务消息，本地管理多个分支事务的一致性，事务消息暂时对多分支事务没有支持。另外，如果有问题烦请订阅邮件列表:https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/ ,issue 用来做bug report或者是feature request.
另外推荐暂时使用4.3.0版本的客户端，4.3.1版本稍有问题，我们后续发布新版本解决该问题。

It seems ok to add Thread.sleep，and why do you change loop times from 10000000 to 1000? Do you have any special considerations?
This is indeed a problem if send messages and shutdown process immediately in async mode.

If we use async send message,  local broker will receive too much requests, and will lead to flow controll, so I reduced loop times.

`org.apache.rocketmq.client.exception.MQBrokerException: CODE: 2  DESC: [TIMEOUT_CLEAN_QUEUE]broker busy, start flow control for a while, period in queue: 200ms, size of queue: 115`

@Chuenfai  The maxMessageSize configuration is not supported to config on the fly. The mqadmin cmd only makes the property changed in config file, but not refresh it to the MessageStoreConfig runtime bean. It will be great if you like to provide PR for this new feature, thanks!

## BUG
1. `PROPERTY_CHECK_IMMUNITY_TIME_IN_SECONDS` is not available.
2. `transactionMsgTimeout` is not available.

i use `PROPERTY_CHECK_IMMUNITY_TIME_IN_SECONDS` in java  and `transactionMsgTimeout` in broker.conf ;

@seaHeater How about using a semaphore instead of Thread.sleep?
It seems better to release a semaphore in SendCallBack.
@wangweifan yes, please try this spring-boot function provided in rocketmq-external. https://github.com/apache/rocketmq-externals/tree/master/rocketmq-spring-boot-starter.

@walking98 In fact, the changed config will be updated to MessageStoreConfig at the same time.The reason why need to restart is that, the message buffer is initialed only once at the starting of broker, and according to maxMessageSize.
get it, so the root reason is the message buffer can not be adjusted dynamically after booting.  I am wondering if the behavior can be changed ... :-)

> 请保持同一个consumer group拥有同样的订阅信息，[参考](https://rocketmq.apache.org/docs/best-practice-consumer/)

但是如何使多个实例的consumer处于同一个consumer Group呢?
@githublaohu strongly recommend you to pull a request to the develop branch，and please resolve  conflicts shows above.
